intro: Trema blancoi, commonly known as the white trema, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Trema blancoi is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
